benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/pause - Pause a bundle

covered: PUT - Valid Request: Multiple happy paths (required header only, with requestedDate, with pluginProperty, with optional headers, and all combined) returning 204 and verifying state changes/audit info.
PUT - Non-Existing Resource: 404 for valid-but-missing bundleId and empty DB cases.
PUT - Concurrency Issues: Concurrent pause requests where only one succeeds and others fail appropriately.
Input Validation: Invalid bundleId format (400), already paused/canceled invalid state (400), missing required header (400), past/malformed requestedDate (400), malformed pluginProperty (400).
Security/Robustness: SQL injection in path handled (400, no side effects), XSS in headers handled (400, no script execution), unexpected extra parameters ignored.
Large Payload Handling: Very large pluginProperty array handled (204 or 413).
Integration/Resilience: Upstream API unavailable (503), dependent plugin down (502), downstream consistency verified post-204.
Regression/Isolation: Pausing one bundle does not affect others; special characters in pluginProperty processed.
gaps: Response format: Story specifies Produces: application/json, but tests do not verify Content-Type on error responses or that 204 has no body.
Query param encoding: pluginProperty uses collectionFormat=multi; no test verifies repeated query parameters (pluginProperty=a&pluginProperty=b) are accepted/processed.
Idempotency (sequential): No explicit test that a second pause call after a successful 204 returns the expected error (e.g., 400) when not concurrent.
Authorization granularity: No 403 Forbidden case for an authenticated user lacking permissions (only 401 is covered).
Audit logging completeness: Tests verify reason/comment persistence but not that CreatedBy is recorded in audit/audit headers.
Date boundary/format nuances: No tests for timezone/boundary handling (e.g., today vs tenant timezone) or rejecting date-time values when only date is allowed.
Unexpected request body: API has no body; no test ensures a provided body is rejected or ignored per contract.
Error payload/schema: Tests check presence of error messages but not schema/fields of error responses (e.g., code, message, context) or localization.
recommendations: Add scenarios to assert headers and body expectations: 204 has no body; error responses include Content-Type: application/json and conform to a documented error schema.
Add a scenario sending pluginProperty as repeated query params (pluginProperty=prop1=value1&pluginProperty=prop2=value2) to validate collectionFormat=multi handling.
Add a sequential idempotency test: pause once (204), then pause again (expect 400 with already paused/invalid state).
Include a 403 Forbidden scenario with an authenticated user lacking required role/permission.
Verify audit logging includes X-Killbill-CreatedBy in audit records alongside reason/comment.
Extend requestedDate tests to cover boundary conditions (today in tenant timezone), and reject ISO date-time inputs when only date is allowed.
Add a test that sends a non-empty request body and assert the API rejects it with 400/415 or ignores it per spec.
Validate error payload structure (fields like type, code, message) and stable semantics for client handling.
